fields.description:
This is a similar request as issue [[https://bitbucket.org/site/master/changeset/3612|3612]].\\
E.g. I'm browsing [[https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src/3a22ec4627c3/auiplugin-tests/src/main/java|auiplugin-3.6.3]] and then switch to [[https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src/27619acd21da|auiplugin-3.6.4]] over the tags menu. I'll end up at the root of the repository, also it could have conserved the currently browsed auiplugin-tests/src/main/java path.
fields.summary: Try to conserve path as much as possible when switching to different branch or tag/cs (BB-3572)

fields.description: E.g. requesting [[https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src/27619acd21da/auiplugin/src/doesnotexist|auiplugin-3.6.4 -  /src/doesnotexist]] responds with a 404, but what the application could do is recognise that the request is to a sub-path (after the cs hash) and then try to match the path upwards, e.g. auiplugin/src and then auiplugin and then 27619acd21da. The user then gets //redirected// to that path instead of a 404. The page should have a warning message that this is not the originally requested resource but the closest the application could match.
fields.summary: Context-aware 404 page (BB-2146)

fields.description:
The tags list in the webinterface appears to be unsorted, e.g. https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive\\
{{{\\
...\\
auiplugin-3.7-m6\\
auiplugin-3.7-m4\\
auiplugin-3.6.5\\
auiplugin-3.7-m3\\
auiplugin-3.7-m2\\
auiplugin-3.6.4\\
auiplugin-3.6.3\\
auiplugin-3.5.5\\
auiplugin-3.5.4\\
auiplugin-3.5.3\\
auiplugin-3.6.2\\
auiplugin-3.7-m1\\
...\\
}}}\\
My suggestion would be, if not made configurable, to at least sort them reversed lexicographically (sort -r) by default. This caters imo most of the people as the will have some sort of versioning / number information in their tags.\\
{{{\\
...\\
auiplugin-3.7-m6\\
auiplugin-3.7-m4\\
auiplugin-3.7-m3\\
auiplugin-3.7-m2\\
auiplugin-3.7-m1\\
auiplugin-3.6-m3\\
auiplugin-3.6-m2\\
auiplugin-3.6-m1\\
auiplugin-3.6.5\\
...\\
}}}
fields.summary: Sort tags list  (BB-3570)

fields.description:
We're using bitbucket.org with TortoiseHg and getting the following error:\\
URLError: [Errno 8] _ssl.c:490: EOF occurred in violation of protocol

bitbucket is mapped to the following IPs for us:\\
207.223.240.181 and\\
207.223.240.182

181 has an SSL handshake failure and no certificate

Can you fix this server problem?
fields.summary: SSL Error: EOF in violation of protocol.

fields.description:
There is a bug in bitbucket when the user has two accounts registered - and replies to an incident or invitation from one account, while the browser is open to a bitbucket repo for the other account.  Here is the explanation:

# I had a bitbucket repo open for user taxeo_tech, which should have only access for Taxeo repos, and is associated to an email address s.burke@taxeo.com
# I have another account for a totally unrelated project, Amexis, that is associated to email sburke@verkarotech.com
# I received an email invitation for a new Amexis repo to the email address sburke@verkarotech.com.  I clicked the link and opened this in the same browser where I was presently logged into the Taxeo repos using the taxeo_tech account.
# bitbucket then gave access for taxeo_tech to the Amexis repo.  when I logged out and logged back in as sburke@verkarotech.com, bitbucket blocked the access and said that the invitation was already taken.

desired behavior - bitbucket should have understood that the logged in account (taxeo_tech) was not the intended assignee for the Amexis repo and not given access to taxeo_tech.
fields.summary: bitbucket does not control access when the user has two accounts which should have access to different repos (BB-3566)

fields.description:
* On the MixJenkinsCI account I have created a pull request from the MixWIP repository to the MixMaster repository.
* I then choose the accept pull request option. A confirmation dialog appears on which I also accept the pull request.
* The button disables and nothing further happens.
fields.summary: Accepting a pull request does not succeed

fields.description:
Currently when I create or edit issues, I get notification emails.  But this doesn't make sense because I'm the person doing the editing!  I don't need a notification to tell me what I did!  I should only get a notification email when someone else creates or edits an issue.

I couldn't find a setting for this, nor did I find anything in the forums or the documentation.
fields.summary: Creating/editing an issue should not send email to me if I edited it.

fields.description:
Bitbucket mails me my own comments.  Why?  It is annoying.  No other platform I know does this.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Avoid mailing users their own comments

fields.description: Backslashes are deleted from comments, even if escaped.
fields.summary: Backslashes are deleted from comments

fields.description:
Having syntax highlighting applied to code snippets within READMEs would be very nice indeed.

See http://www.freewisdom.org/projects/python-markdown/CodeHilite.
fields.summary: Enable Python-Markdown's CodeHilite extension (BB-3560)
Upgrade to the latest version of Pygments to support syntax highlighting of Fantom code (BB-3559)

fields.description: I see the name of the user i shared the repo with, on a wrong place on the screen.
fields.summary: Some name appears at the screen.

fields.description:
The Jenkins service does not work for git repositories (it might for mercurial, I have not checked).

As a test I configured two services for a repository: //Email diff// and //Jenkins//. The //Email diff// services works perfectly: immediately after a commit I get an email with the full diff. The //Jenkins// services did not do anything. Looking at the apache logs for our (unsecured) Jenkins instance  I can see that bitbucket does not attempt to do a POST (or GET or any other request).

I'm marking this as critical since the workaround is to configure polling in jenkins, which will increase the load on the bitbucket platform.
fields.summary: Jenkins services does not work (BB-3563)

https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine doesn't seem to update and remove repo's that are deleted.

going to https://bitbucket.org/username will show the correct list of existing repo's

fields.description:
Hi all ,

I met a problem about username alias just now.

I have two accounts below :

EragonJ - with 2 email ( eragonj@hax4.in , eragonj@eragonj.me )

and

Hax4 - with 1 email ( admin@hax4.in )

Originally ,

I used eragonj@hax4.in to register Hax4 account at first for test, but later , I decided to make a primary email for it ( which is admin@hax4.in )

And also ,

My original email account is eragonj@eragonj.me , but because of concurrent development with teammates, I decided to add another email with hax4.in suffix to my account ( that is eragonj@hax4.in )

After I changed both emails of two accounts ( account hax4 : from eragonj@hax4.in to admin@hax4.in , and my personal account EragonJ : from eragonj@eragonj.me to eragonj@hax4.in ), I tried to make some new commits with new email identification :

{{{\\
#!bash

git config --add user.email "eragonj@hax4.in"\\
}}}

But problems happened !!

After I made new commits with this identification , the commit maker links to original hax4 account !!! This may be a caching issue or some bugs in account alias, please dig it out if you guys have some spare time ;)

Thanks for your reading ;)
fields.summary: username aliases aren't updated when displaying previous commits in activity (BB-3554)

fields.description:
I am unable to get the FogBugz integration service to post to my hosted fogbugz account.

Following the directions for the service:

h1. Go to admin / source control
h1. Click create new repository
h1. Select other (custom)
h1. Click next
FogBugz gives me the following URL:\\
https://astonishdesigns.fogbugz.com/cvsSubmit.asp?ixBug=bugID&sFile=file&sPrev=x&sNew=y&ixRepository=45

The directions are a bit ambiguous at this point.  Do I remove ixRespository from the submit URL and put it in the repository ID field? Do I leave the URL as is, and just paste the ID number (45) into the repository ID field? Do I leave the URL as is and paste the entire parameter (ixRepository=45) into the ID field?

I have tried all these variations, but in no cases are commits being picked up by FogBugz.
fields.summary: FogBugz service is not working (BB-3544)

In the programming language drop down selection would you please add "REALbasic".  There are more than 150,000 users of this language so I think it is at least worthy of being the list.  :)

Also, it would be nice if the repositories could have some kind of "logical" grouping option.  It could be implemented any number of ways, but what I really would like to be able to do is group "like" repositories together somehow and have that displayed in the UI.

Thanks,

Craig

fields.description:
It looks like events api use limit argument as "stop" argument.

{{{\\
curl https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/eterverda/events/ --user eterverda:password\\
}}}\\
Returns 15 events (not 25 as mentioned in docs) of 109

{{{\\
curl https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/eterverda/events/?start=1 --user eterverda:password\\
}}}\\
Returns 14 events. The very first (oldest one) from previous 15 excluded.

{{{\\
curl https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/eterverda/events/?start=14 --user eterverda:password\\
}}}\\
Returns only the very last event of 15.

If I play with limit argument I can browse up to 50 issues. For example\\
{{{\\
curl https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/eterverda/events/?start=45&limit=50 --user eterverda:password\\
}}}\\
Returns events 45 to 50.

There is no way to browse newer events because limit is limited to 50.
fields.summary: Events API seem to be broken (BB-3542)

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a system that automatically adds replies to tickets in our support system when an issue is resolved.

{{{status=resolved&sort=utc_last_updated}}}

The above query works to sort the issues by the time they were last updated but I do not seem to be able to get it to reverse the sorting to show the most recently updated issues first.

I've tried {{{sort=-utc_last_updated}}} but this still sorts them with oldest first.

I've marked this as a blocker as it is going to prevent us from using the API completely until this is addressed.
fields.summary: API Issues sorting (BB-3518)

fields.description:
Bitbucket supports adding services to commits e.g. email, issue tracker update etc.

Generally developers get the commits via the email service. But I like the idea of also enabling the issue tracker service for the sole reason of be able to see all the code changes done for a particular issue at one place.

But when both the services (email & issues) is enabled, we end up getting duplicate emails for a single commit (one from email and other from issue tracker update).

It would be great if you guys can provide an option to disable issue tracker notifications if the update is done via the commit.

Please let me know if you need more info.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Support for disabling notifications on issue tracker when the update is done via commit (BB-3567)

fields.description:
I'm doing pull requests on a git repo and keep getting taken to the wrong page when choosing branches because the UI is difficult to use.  When I expand the dropdown to choose branches it's far too easy to accidentally click the branch name or the commit hash for any particular option.  I'm forced to pay very close attention when choosing a branch so that I click the dropdown item without clicking any of the links therein.

I would be much happier if there weren't links inside of the dropdowns to select branches on a pull request.
fields.summary: Very frustrating UX when choosing branches of a pull request

fields.description:
I'm trying to get my sales team to enter bugs and feature requests directly into Bitbucket.

They want email notifications when

#An issue is assigned to them\\
#An issue which they have reported is updated\\
\\\\
But they only have two options\\\
#Be notified of every change to every ticket in a given repository\\
#Be notified of nothing\\

There is an option, when creating a ticket, to be notified of updates to that ticket. I'm not sure the functionality is working correctly. Even if it did, it would satisfy neither of the two cases detailed above.

BUT. If you guys had fixed my bug report [[https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3299/gmail-parseable-token-in-email|gmail parseable token in email]] ... She could just filter using MS Outlook. It's such a tiny change to the output template - I find it difficult to understand why it hasn't been resolved.

Can the Bitbucket team offer any suggestions. Or am I stuck with a system (for the time being) which I can't get my staff to use?
fields.summary: Irrelevant emails being broadcast

Thanks
fields.summary: add support for Gambas repository

fields.description: A GET request (+basic auth header) to https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/jaeboston/backofficeready/changesets/4dc2025c88af/diffstat issued by the JIRA Bitbucket connector (https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/BBC-132) returns a 500 status code.
fields.summary: GET diffstat for a particular changeset on the changesets REST resource fails (BB-3478)

fields.description:
A long time ago, Bitbucket used to allow you to view the list of users following an issue.  This can be useful when you've created an issue for someone and then you fix said issue, but the person you created it for isn't following the issue (so they don't know it's been fixed).  In these cases, I like to notify the person directly, but without the followers list I have no way of knowing whether they were automatically notified by Bitbucket.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Regain the ability to view the list of an issue's followers (BB-3488)

fields.description:
Sorry for posting this as an issue, but I'm really tired of facing this.

Few minutes ago I've found more than 50 letters with issues from bitbucket in my inbox (It's 700+ letters in inbox folder for this weekend).

I've tried to figure out why does filter didn't moved all of the letters to appropriate folder and found that all the letters were sent from issues-reply@bitbucket.org instead of issues-noreply@bitbucket.org.\\
It wasn't the problem to move all the stuff to separate folder and fix the filter, but It's not pleasure to trying to figure out what da hell has happen.

I'm reading your blog and twitter, but there was nothing.\\
And it's not the first time bitbucket makes me sad. And not the second.

So please read the title again and try to think as bitbucket user with 3+ active projects or people will continue preferring github.

Regards,

Vladimir.
fields.summary: Care about your users

fields.description:
I think that a tagging system for repositories may be very useful to perform repository list filtering and taxonomy clasification.

Relevant both web-UI and API.
fields.summary: tag for repositories (BB-3486)

fields.description:
Servise offers to "Sign up" after a successfull "Log in"\\
See details in attachment.

Thanks for the greate servise!
fields.summary: Servise offers to "Sign up" after a successfull "Log in" (BB-3489)

fields.description:
The documentation on permissions (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Repository+Privacy%2C+Permissions%2C+and+More) does not explicitly state the behaviour relating to modifying properties of issues.

In our public repository with a public tracker, a bitbucket user (who does not have write permissions to the repository) was able to resolve an issue.  I believe this is a bug.
fields.summary: Only allow issue creator and repo writers to modify issue peoperties (BB-7765)

fields.description:
Hello,

I work for rally software, owner of agilezen.com and I am working on an integration for adding commit info to our users' projects when they make a commit to bitbucket.  I would like to get the integration added to your services dropdown if at all possible.\\
In order for that to work, we would need two fields, one for "project id" and one for "api key".  I have written a broker (which is based on the POST broker in your docs) which assumes that these two values come in as payload['service']['projectId'] and payload['service']['apikey'], which is attached.\\
Would you mind working with me to test and add this to your services list?

Thank you,\\
Ryan Curtis\\
rcurtis@rallydev.com
fields.summary: add agilezen.com service (BB-3490)

fields.description:
I have couple of private repositories hosted under my account (mayanks78). I had 5 users in some of the repositories. But recently when I tried removing one user and adding a new user, It rejected my request saying that I had passed the free limit of 5 users. But after removing one of the users, that repository only has 4 users.

I think there is some bug over here. Do let me know if you are able to fix it. Would like to help you in providing more information if needed.
fields.summary: Not allowing me to add new users

fields.description:
Hi

The main PyPy repo (/pypy/pypy) is taking a lot of time to push to. It's 15s-2min. Given fast pace of pypy development this creates endless push-fail-because someone else pushed, pull merge, try again, fail...

Is there anything that can be done or does it have to stay that way?

Cheers,\\
fijal
fields.summary: PyPy repository push taking forever (BB-3487)

fields.description: When viewing a "code behind" source file in C#, the layout is all mashed up. Looks like it is all on one line.
fields.summary: C# isn't formatted in source view

fields.description: When I click "Log In" from my URL (9gs.bitbucket.org) the page is not found.  However, it works fine when I click it from the root URL. Thought you guys might want to know.  See attached photo.
fields.summary: Login Location (BB-3481)

fields.description:
* Using the Opera browser, login and load https://bitbucket.org/account/#ssh-keys
* Click [Choose key] and select a .pub file; the file name appears ok
* Click [Upload key]

The error message is "Invalid file type".

PS: This works in Chrome, which I found out after a lot of generating different types of certificates
fields.summary: Uploading public SSH key fails on Opera
https://dwz7u9t8u8usb.cloudfront.net/m/427eecceaf2a/bun/img/priorities.png

fields.description:
==== Description: ====\\
When navigating through the source of a project and annotate mode is turned on, clicking on any of the breadcrumb links ( except the root one ) produces an HTTP 404.

==== Reproduction: ====

* Navigate to the source of a file in a project, assuming that this file sits in a nested directory within the project
* Turn on annotate mode by clicking "annotate" near the top of the source file viewer
* Click on any of the breadcrumb links, you should get an HTTP 404

==== Additional ====\\
The root breadcrumb is unaffected, only nested ones are affected. I've included some pics to help out.
fields.summary: HTTP 404 with breadcrumb in source annotate mode

fields.description:
This is more important than it sounds, please take a minute to read this guys :)

Other open-source hostings (codeplex, google-code, sourceforge, github etc etc etc) allow basic HTML-editing on project pages. So people can add "retweet" buttons, CSS tricks, JavaScript-demos and other cool stuff to their open-source project sites.

With Bitbucket - I have to host the site elsewhere, since you do not allow HTML on project pages.
fields.summary: Allow safe HTML tags to be rendered in markdown readmes (BB-3562)

fields.description:
I know that I am supposed to have an invitation from user "gbadge". However, I have not received an inbox notification nor an email. Gbadge is not able to re-send the invitation either.

Can you please fix this bug, so that we can start working on a shared project together?

Thank you.

Josh
fields.summary: Invitation

fields.description:
Hello,

Could you please help me to identify why I cannot clone a repository "usamultimeters.com" in my account "bdenisenko".\\
I tried several times and every time I receive the error as on the image attached.

The version of my TurtoiseHg tools is 2.2.2

Thank you.
fields.summary: Cannot clone a repository

fields.description:
Every profile I enter, I see on the right side under Repositories :{user} has no public repositories.

But I see on the Recent activity stream when they commit to repos, and I can also enter them or follow link to them if they are public. I just don't see them listed on the profile.
fields.summary: No public repos listed on profiles, even though there are

fields.description: In issue edit mode "picture" has wrong icon (icon of "code").
fields.summary: Wrong "picture" icon in issue edit mode. (BB-3473)
File uploading on custom domain cause server error.

fields.description:
Hi,

We've been trying unsuccessfully to use the Jenkins plugin with a secured instance of Jenkins.

Is it possible to get the source of the service to see if we can troubleshoot what is going on?

For example, the plugin allows for the use of a token, but no username -- which seems a little strange.

Thanks,\\
Don
fields.summary: Jenkins service does not work with secured Jenkins server (BB-3617)

fields.description: It seems that even if I am 'following' a repository, emails are only sent to me if I am the issue owner or assignee (if that, see BCLOUD-3530). Even when someone reassigns one of my issues to themselves, I don't seem to get an e-mail notification to that effect.
fields.summary: No way to get email about all issues (BB-3467)

fields.description: Three issues were created in our issue tracker in the last day or so, all assigned to me.  I only received an e-mail notification for the first of the three.
fields.summary: Email not sent when new issue assigned to me

fields.description:
Hi. To support GitHub Flow like process we need to have inter-branch pull requests (create pull requests between branches in one repo).

As you can guess, GitHub already does that.

Is it possible to do that? I think it is really helpful for code reviews.
fields.summary: In-repo pull requests

fields.description:
When I view a single commit, I'd like to be able to go to the next one with a simple link.

I know that in DVCS commits don't have to be linear, but most of the time, they are, so I think it would be useful.

Someone is reporting the same here : http://groups.google.com/group/bitbucket-users/browse_thread/thread/570d860413c59fc

But I haven't found anything in the issue DB regarding "next commit" or "next change". Hope this isn't a duplicate.
fields.summary: Add a Next Commit button while viewing one commit (Git)

fields.description: Currently, the button "My issues" doesn't show issues I created anymore. It just shows issues I'm responsible for.
fields.summary: "My Issues" doesn't show issues I created (BB-3468)

fields.description:
Problem:

I enable access to a project on a server, where other people also have access to. The assigned SSH key leaves open access to my other repositories. Current solution is to register another account just to handle this scenario, but IMO it's nonsense to have a separate project owner for every production server. Not only because you have to register, confirm email, assign admin, etc. every time, but because these project don't appear in 'My repositories' (btw, it'd be nice if projects I'm admin of appeared in a more accessible section)

Example solutions:

* upload SSH keys in project admin panel, not user admin panel
* leave as it is and add checkboxes with a 'restrict access' option where you select which project would this key give access to
fields.summary: Assign SSH keys per project (currently: per user account) (BB-3019)
Bitbucket URL - Safe format

fields.description:
It would be tremendous helpful to be able to  customize the submit page. For both anonymous and logged users.

**Example: **

A new release of Diagramo is released 2.1. For it a "report bug" link will be provided with custom URL(https://bitbucket.org/scriptoid/Diagramo/issues/new?version=2.1)

Now....when someone using that app will submit a bug, that version (2.1) will be auto-completed.
fields.summary: Customize submit via parameters (BB-3451)

fields.description:
I have my email notifications set to on, but I don't seem to be getting any emails sent to me. I have checked my spam folder. Not sure if it is a fault on my side or yours, but I also don't have much to go on.

This is quite an important feature for me, so I appreciate any help.
fields.summary: Not Getting Email Notifications

fields.description: I have an OpenID, but my provider is not listed on the login page, so I can't log in. StackOverflow has a box to manually enter your own ID, and that works.
fields.summary: List of OpenID providers does not allow others to be specified

fields.description:
I suggest you improve way to invite users to repository. I was stuck when system asks me my friend's email. I know alias only and I have contacts in Inbox. May be would be great add into "Invite friend" feature not only email, but SELECTor with currently known people (from Inbox).

Have a nice day.
fields.summary: Must be improved, certainly

fields.description:
When I created an issue named 'follow', I met infinite redirection to

https://bitbucket.org/<account>/<repo>/issue/<num>/follow

I guess /follow is special key to make user follow the issue, but it is also used as meaningful url.

Please stop title finger special commands and save me from infinite redirection trap :)

ps. I also guess that you may prohibit special commands already, but in this case, i used some hangul characters on title and all of them are excluded, except 'follow'.
fields.summary: infinite follow bug in issues

fields.description: This repository is quite large (1.5GB reported in the web UI).  Trying to browse in the web UI results in an error.  When pulling using TortoiseHG I get a stream failure after a substantial period (1+ hour). I'm taking over the repo so am not sure what's causing it to be so large (assume media of some form) but am expecting that I shouldn't have the problems I'm having.  Repository reference I'm using is https://swaight@bitbucket.org/TheFarm/car0001-carnation-website
fields.summary: Unable to pull from repository.
change $charset  contstant to settings::get('locale')

fields.description:
I changed the times character (×) by the × entity in one of my files.\\
But the diff in BitBucket is not displaying correctly.\\
It is converting the × into the times character (×) again.

See the following changeset: https://bitbucket.org/felipeptcho/wyfer/changeset/482b38de0f7a
fields.summary: Diff display fails showing text containing some entity characters like ×

fields.description:
I have a pull request from a user. The request is against a repo that the user deleted before I could pull. Discovered this on Saturday and tried to reject through my iphone. The reject hung. I'm not sure why...

Now, I can't request going from my Mac. Maybe the problem wasn't the iphone at all but...well I can't reject the thing.
fields.summary: Cannot reject pull request

fields.description:
I committed using an email address that matched to atlassian_tutorial. Since I want all my commits to show up as tutorials, I created an alias for atlassian_tutorial to tutorials.

Well, it doesn't appear to be working.  I expected existing commits to show up with the new alias.
fields.summary: Aliasing does not seem to be working

fields.description:
Hi There,\\
File upload feature for uploading ssh key is not working under ubuntu (10.10), firefox(v 3.6.10). Have not tried from other browser.
fields.summary: Choose File to upload ssh key not working
